vectors.text: Transformer architecture uses self-attention mechanisms for sequence processing
Reinforcement learning trains agents through reward signals and environment interaction
Large language models predict next tokens using billions of learned parameters
Microservices architecture decomposes applications into small independent services
Container orchestration manages deployment and scaling of containerized applications
Event-driven architecture uses events to trigger and communicate between services
GPUs accelerate parallel computing with thousands of cores for matrix operations
Quantum computers use qubits that can exist in superposition states
Neuromorphic chips mimic brain structure for energy-efficient AI computation
Diffusion models generate data by learning to reverse a noise addition process
Vector databases enable semantic search using high-dimensional embeddings
GraphQL provides a query language for APIs with typed schemas
WebAssembly enables near-native performance for web applications
TPUs are application-specific integrated circuits optimized for tensor operations
Federated learning trains models across decentralized devices without sharing data
Serverless computing automatically manages infrastructure and scaling
NVMe storage provides low-latency access through PCIe interface
Mixture of experts routes inputs to specialized sub-networks
CQRS separates read and write operations for complex domains
In-memory computing processes data directly where it is stored
